nodes.description: Segregation-User Fees: Differential pricing for mixed vs. segregated

links.quantification: Price incentive → segregation compliance 30%→80% → households save ₹200/month on lower fees → behavioral shift to source separation
Segregated collection → processing efficiency +50% → ₹8K Cr municipal waste management costs avoided → fiscal sustainability
Clean material streams → recycling sector feedstock quality improves → 60% recovery rate (vs. 20% mixed) → ₹12K Cr circular economy market
Organic waste diversion → composting replaces landfilling → 40% methane emissions avoided → 5 MT CO₂e reduction annually
Equity concerns: User fees burden low-income households → ₹500/month cost vs. ₹8K/month income → affordability subsidies needed
Collection infrastructure gap: Dual-bin system needs ₹5K Cr vehicle fleet + door-to-door coverage → 5-year rollout period
Landfill diversion → land footprint -60% → habitat degradation avoided → ecosystem recovery → biodiversity increases (reinforcing)
Requires behavior change infrastructure: User fees only effective with education campaigns + bin availability → ₹500 Cr awareness prerequisite
Via recycling growth: Material recovery → ₹10K Cr sector investments → municipal tipping fees revenue +30% → fiscal space
Via landfill reduction: Methane emissions -40% → GHG mitigation → climate resilience → community heat stress reduction
Via land recovery: 60% landfill footprint reduction → 50K ha land available for urban green space → ecosystem services improve
